website_summaries.verdict: A good-looking portable heater that offers impressive performance, provided you don't get a "lemon" unit.
pros: Heats up rooms and moderately sized living spaces fairly quickly and quietly with even warmth without exposed heating elements
Easy to slide from room to room without tipping
cons: A few faulty models and units that quit working after a few months have been reported, and customer service could be more attentive

website_summaries.verdict: This unit's unique dual system uses infrared heating and convection to warm quickly and comfortably without cold spots.
pros: Efficiently transfers heat using dual infrared quartz and PTC heating
cons: Unit itself does not get hot to the touch, but the metal grate at the front does

website_summaries.verdict: You'd have a hard time finding a space heater with more to offer thanks to this model's solid construction, dual heating system, and good looks.
pros: An attractive design with a sturdy build that isn't easy to tip over
Delivers 1,500 watts of power to produce warm, comfortable infrared and PTC heat that's ideal for medium to large spaces
Casters make it easy to move
cons: Remote and front control panel have been reported to malfunction

customer_reviews.title: Junk !! I am an Electrician. Chinese junk. 1 out of 4 I purchased worked for more than 5 hours.
customer_reviews.text: Junk !! I am an Electrician. Chinese junk. 1 out of 4 I purchased worked for more than 5 hours. The open faced radiant quartz infrared heaters that are not all boxed up heat the best!! If you cannot see the quartz infrared heating element it cannot heat as well. EXAMPLE IS A Comfort Zone Radiant Quartz Tower Heater. buy that !!
customer_reviews.author: jarad b skaggs

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This heater is great. If I put it on 73F for the night and its the only heat source I have right now {other than one other small heater in a closed room) my 2 story aprx 1200 sq ft house is very warm in the morning. I'm most comfortable with it at 68F. I have not had to put it over 74F yet and we have gotten down into the 30s. The filter is easy to clean and I try to clean it every few days due to having 1 dog, 3 cats and 4 guinea pigs.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: OVER HEATED/ BURNED UP AFTER JUST ONE USE! CRAZY!
customer_reviews.text: My elderly Mom used it for only one day & the fan stopped working which made it over heat, stinking up her apartment with burned smells & a truly scary experience! Thankful that there wasn't a fire! One star, certainly not for the product, but for Amazon who makes returns so nice & easy. Thank you Amazon; your excellent customer service is unparalleled!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy online. Terrible service. 🔥
customer_reviews.text: . Loved this heater but, had only used it 2 months and when I turned it on auto 68 it overheated the wire and plug going into wall socket melting plug above it and almost causing a fire. I feel this was a faulty heater or wire. After contacting seller he absolutely refused to think that could be the case. I couldn’t get a word in, he kept talking over me. Needless to say there has been no resolution and I would Not recommend purchasing because of poor poor customer service! This man was absolutely ridiculous. This is one reason too not to purchase appliances online! Go to your local store
customer_reviews.author: Deborah R Fries

customer_reviews.title: Purchase of the year
customer_reviews.text: I went through last year's NYC winter in my drafty pre-war apartment wearing three layers at night. Not in 2016! This heater is small but it's really powerful. I expect an increase in my electric bill but it's a small price to pay for comfort. I live in a building with heat controlled by the owner, so I can't increase the temperature in my home without a portable heater like this. The added electrical cost might be worth considering if you aren't in a situation like mine. But for me, this is a great little addition to my life. Highly recommend. It's worth the price for the quality you get. I'm VERY a happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mary C

customer_reviews.title: Top notch product. Tried and true.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little heater. Cranks out the heat. Quiet and easy to use. Looks good and operation costs are hardly a blip on my electricity bill. I heat up and entire garage bay that isn't exactly airtight with this thing and it maintains a nice 68 degrees. The thermostat has a nice delay on it so it is not on and off every two seconds. Highly recommended. I used this for an entire Idaho winter so this isn't a knee-jerk review.
customer_reviews.author: Product Owner/Seller

customer_reviews.title: I wish my review was as good as this heater!
customer_reviews.text: I got this along with another heater of the same type. This one works equally well and it's the quietest heater with a blower that I own. I use space heaters to heat half a duplex and this year we had unusually cold temps right after I got this. I dreaded the electric bill but to my amazement the bill was lower than it should have been. The reason is I got two very efficient heaters. This one looks nice and the wood body muffles the sound of the blower. Win Win. Certainly earns 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Rambler

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, sloppy cosmetic work
customer_reviews.text: I researched IR heaters before deciding on this one, as it consistently was in the top 2. It Heats up the room very quickly. I like the wood cabinet, controls are easy to read & figure out what you want it to do. The remote makes it very handy to control from another room, but the unit has to be ON for the remote to work. I was disappointed in the quality of the cabinet work. 2 of the corners on the top look like someone dinged it with a hammer & tried to cover the mistake with wood stain, sloppy workmanship there. The unit itself rates 5 stars, the sloppy cosmetic issues pulls my rating down one star.
customer_reviews.author: Fiddler

customer_reviews.title: Cord melted.
customer_reviews.text: The heater worked pretty good to keep my room that stays a little colder then the rest up to temperature but it melted the cord my my outlet. I tried to email and call but I got nothing back from them at all. Says 3 year warranty but I can't seem to get it after not even 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job. A bit loud. Thermostat could be improved.
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but it's pretty loud and the way it goes about maintaining a constant temperature in the room is kind of annoying. The temperature in our bedroom drops below 74, it kicks on for 10 seconds, then silence for 5 minutes, then it kicks on for 10 seconds. It disturbs our sleep a bit. I think a range would be more useful; for instance, we would like it between 72-77.. when it hits 71 it kicks on until it reaches 77, then turns off until it reaches 72 again. May be something wrong with that concept, but it's the right direction.
customer_reviews.author: Booyakashalaka

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Can not attest to longevity as I have only had it for 4 days but so far I like it. Heat output seems good - unit seems very quiet. Gave it 4 stars instead of 5 for a few features it should have. Lights on front are REALLY bright- should have ability to dim as I would not want to use this in my bedroom. Can not get the unit to display room temperature per owners manual. The overall operation of unit is very simple- I like that Would I buy again- YES
customer_reviews.author: Brad Ersly

customer_reviews.title: My 35' travel trailer stays comfortable all night here in the cold desert climate
customer_reviews.text: I was leary buying this heater. I had one, actually 3 by the time I sent it back & back & back, that promised what this one does. I won't mention the brand of the other heater but I will say that this one does what it says it will do. My 35' travel trailer stays comfortable all night here in the cold desert climate. I would recommend it for any small space heating requirement. It keeps my trailer in the mid 60's while the outside temp drops to freezing every night. The controls are simple and importantly, they work fine..
customer_reviews.author: Tom Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: I had multiple units catch fire.
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these whilst in the honeymoon phase because they are great at heating up a room quickly as advertised, but two attempted to catch fire, and all three would suddenly turn on without warning when no one was in the room. I would warn everyone to stay away from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Really great heater BUT...
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a heater for my home Yoga studio. I tried radiators because they’re silent but not enough heat. I bought this thing and yes, it’s very quiet, but the fan comes on every 5 min and it becomes annoying fast. I wish it could check the temperature in the room silently without the fan kicking on, or disable the thermostat feature. Great heater, a little ugly and a tad annoying , but seems like a great product.
customer_reviews.author: WizardMan420

customer_reviews.title: It Works better than Eden Pure.
customer_reviews.text: I use electric heat in my RV vs propane to avoid any COLD night surprises. I sold my 2015 Chaparral and let the EP heater go. I recently bought 2017 Bighorn that is a little larger. I wanted to try the Dr Heater because I had seen so much about it. It does put out a stonger penetrating heat than my previous Eden Pure in my last RV and $119 vs $250-425 is a no brainer. If there is a down side, I cant find it. Even the control is comfortable and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Bought in Oct. 2018 and it worked great until now. I had it on stand by so I could use it with remote. Heater was not being used. Whole house electric went off and on. No breakers tripped. Smelled something in room with heater. Noticed heater digital display was on but not readable, The heater was giving off heat. (burning inside, smelled like wires) I unplugged it and stopped using it. If I was asleep or not home the house could have burned down. I bought this heater because I thought it wasn't the typical electric heater you hear that burns houses down. It costs enough to be safe but wasn't.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Nov 2019 used few times and it Stopped working only had it for like few days, return Full refund
customer_reviews.text: Nov 2019 Only had this for few days, ran it on low, low temp and it just quit, its really sad this seem to have good reviews, now a days everything simply is JUNK!!! The new Norm is it does not last long at all who knows whats wrong with this one only used it few times. Returning for full refund no way will I replace it especially since you depend on something to give you Heat definitely will never buy anything from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eh , kind of works
customer_reviews.text: Been using Lasko Ceramic Towers for year and when it was time to upgrade I thought I would do some research and this came up as a good one for larger rooms. The room is about 400sf and although it has two heat ducts it just gets chilly if you leave the close, so I supplement with a space heater. This one took two hours to raise the temp from 64 to 69,never really went past 71 and only shut down a couple times . I would say it works for small rooms maybe 100 to 200sf but not larger rooms, imo.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in 34ft motorhome
customer_reviews.text: Pulled out of the box. Put the batteries supplied in the remote and plugged it in. Puts out plenty of heat and shuts off at the temperature I dialed in that was comfortable. Furnace went out in my 34 foot motorhome where I am using it. Placed it in the middle of the RV under the dinette and heats my rig evenly. Beautiful cabinet and looks luxurious. I managed a company that makes heaters so I realize with electronics you can get early life failure. It's a box of chocolates and I was lucky enough not to get a lemon this time. Most of the reviews were pretty old and perhaps improvements have been made to make it better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Olson

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent in my three season room in cold WI winters ...
customer_reviews.text: Works excellent in my three season room in cold WI winters however no matter what any heater will be expensive to run constantly to heat a room that isn't normally heated throughout the winter. This one is no exception to the rule. Even on the coldest days of the winter this year though, it kept up with demand of a setting at 68 F. in a room like I said that is normally not heated.
customer_reviews.author: Tanto

customer_reviews.title: So the smell...Keep the heater it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to write a review for those of you who notice a pretty toxic smell when you first get your heater. I ran it outside for four hours the first day I got it and brought it back into use it. It filled my house with the most terrible smell I could barely sleep. So I ran outside again a little bit over the course of the next few days, specifically I ran my heater for a total of 20 hours over the course of one week outside on my porch. It felt pretty weird to do that but the smell went away and I am so happy with this heater.
customer_reviews.author: ac

customer_reviews.title: This heater is not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I had this heater for a couple of days and then it stopped working returned it and replace it with another one and that one came and it was all cracked at this point I just gave up and just went and bought a whole different heater I would not recommend this heater to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This buttons on this heater are annoying and do not function well
customer_reviews.text: This buttons on this heater are annoying and do not function well. They would 'stick' or just not respond at all. It also puts out a lot of light which I do not want at night in a bedroom. It finally quit altogether after four winters of light use. I suggest you buy another brand/style of heater. This one is simply junk.
customer_reviews.author: Top Dog Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not good to hear a 400 SF garage.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heater to heat up my Approximately 400 square foot garage. I don’t notice any difference at all in terms of overall temp. The only way to feel the difference is by standing directly in front of the heater. So for me, this did not work as advertised and was not in line with all these reviews proclaiming it heated the reviewers garage well. I can tell it would work well in a smaller indoor room though. Likely returning unless the wife has another use for it.
customer_reviews.author: ~Warrior30~

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t work as good as they say. We have a room the same size requirements as the company states and it never turns off or heats the room to what the company says it does. I’m not happy at all regarding the cost of my purchase and the heat output of the heater besides that it’s seems to be built to a good quality but that dies not at all make up for the company’s output stats.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Tishler

customer_reviews.title: Heats good - doesn't last long - warranty useless - customer service among worst I have ever seen
customer_reviews.text: Heated fine for about 10 months. Stopped working properly - called tech service - they diagnosed it , charged $5 for postage and said they would mail the part. Gave credit card number - nothing has been charged to card and no part has arrived. Good heater while it works - customer service is among the worst I have ever seen and the warranty is worthless. Would never buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: MGM

customer_reviews.title: Heats a room up fast.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a 12x14 shed that I converted into a guest cabin. It blends nicely with my decor and won't burn your hands if you touch it while it's on like those metal heaters can. It heats the room up quickly and comfortably. I absolutely love how simple it is to operate. If you're looking for a nice space heater, this is definitely a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Kim H.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit January 2019. Used it for three months and then put it away for the summer months. Took it out a week ago and the unit no longer works. It will come on and warm for about five minutes and then shuts down. After several emails and finally a telephone conversation with the manufacturer, I was told that they would either send the "part" that they think is the problem at my expense or, I can ship the unit back to them and for a "fee", they will repair it. No thanks. So much for the 3 year warranty. I gave it one star, ONLY because I couldn't submit the review without it.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My family room was originally half of a two-car garage and was poorly insulated at the time of its renovation in 1963. It is the coldest room in my house and heating it with electric baseboard heat breaks the bank. Set on high, this attractive heater had the room warm and cozy within only 10 minutes, a feat never accomplished by the ceramic and air-circulating heaters I used in the past. I'm also impressed by how quietly this unit operates, and the non-drying heat is a real pleasure during our bitterly cold New England winters. In fact, I like it so much that I plan to order another one for my bedroom!
customer_reviews.author: pam

customer_reviews.title: Won't heat 1000SF. Works ok unless it gets cold.
customer_reviews.text: I have held off on reviewing until I had a chance to use this. I live in a 336 square foot "mini house" that is fully insulated. I purchased this heater as a primary heat source because of the rave reviews and the boasted 1000sf capability. I will flat out say that I don't believe it. The best I have been able to do is heat the front half of the house during the day and the bedroom at night. In fairness, it seemed to do pretty decent until the outside temperature dropped below about 50 degrees F.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a year
customer_reviews.text: This heater put out a nice amount of heat but the second winter we tried to use it, it would not turn on. The thermostat was also questionable in that the temperature reading on the heater was way different than the actual temperature in the room, and sometimes the thermostat had to be turned way up for it to even turn on, even in a chilly room. It was way too much money for something that only lasted one year and didn’t save us any money on our gas bill. If anything it increased our electric bill.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Binkley

customer_reviews.title: Like the Energizer Bunny of Electric Heaters
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heater in 2015 to help heat about a 450 square foot area upstairs where we sleep. We have several pellets stoves on the first floor (it's a big OLD farmhouse), but they only kept the upstairs between 45-58 degrees depending on how cold it is outside. This little heater is on a thermostat and runs all winter long. October to April...it keeps our sleeping area warm and cozy all winter! I thought I'd write this review, because when I turned it on after sitting all summer, it worked like a charm, and I was reminded how much I love this little heater! Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Dr. Heater
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great, it had my office warmed up to 70 degrees in a short time. I was looking at heaters & ran across a site that had space heater ratings & this was the top rated heater. Great features & so easy to use. It also arrived 2 or 3 days earlier than expected I had a heater that blew a fuse or something last week that had only been used for about 6 mos total. I called their (NON) customer service twice about the warranty & haven't heard from them yet. I have now replaced 3 heaters in less than 3 years & spent the same amount on this heater that has a 3 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: JAH

customer_reviews.title: Reduced my winter electricity bills
customer_reviews.text: 2 years later and my this is still going strong! We use it in the winter because we have vaulted ceilings and all the heat rises to the ceiling while we freeze downstairs. Then when it's time for bed, we roll it into the bedroom and it keeps us warm all night. Because we don't have to run our heater as high, It's reduced our winter electricity bill significantly.
customer_reviews.author: chelle493

customer_reviews.title: Warranty not honored
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! This company does not honor their warranty. The power switch stopped working on mine. I contacted them multiple times for repair. They will not repair it or replace. They want me to pay shipping and handling for a new switch that they want me to install or pay someone else to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product Failure!!
customer_reviews.text: After only 1 year, this product started to give out a horrible bleach like chemical odor and then suddenly it stopped working. It only blows out cold air. But worse is that we did not get a any support after calling and leaving a message to the company. This is not good customer service. This heater is expensive and it should not be breaking after only a year. Additionally, customer support should be responsive!!
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Throws decent heat, but needs an auto shut-off timer.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to warm up a basement workout room that's roughly 25x20. It's a little too small for the room, but it throws enough heat to take the chill out. The only thing it's really missing is an automatic shut-off timer. I always set a phone reminder/alert to turn it off, because I don't want to absent-mindedly leave it running unattended in my basement. It's a good little heater that looks a little dated (if anyone cares about such things) but the omission of a timer is a pretty big one.
customer_reviews.author: Seventh-777Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Good heater
customer_reviews.text: The only issue that I have had with it , is that the remote control never worked. When we ordered it our heater at home had gone out and was going to take some time to repair so didn’t want to send it back over the remote so we kept it. It works really great even with hight ceilings as long as you use a fan to move the air. I like that it moves very easy on it wheels and has digital temperature control. The settings could be a bit easier to use but it works fine and puts out a good amount of heat.
customer_reviews.author: C. Trejo

customer_reviews.title: Low power mode is great for small rooms or a loaded power circuit
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The heat is instant and hot. If that's all you want from a heater then look no further. Low power mode is great for small rooms or a loaded power circuit. Looks great. Caster wheels roll good. Heavy duty power cord. Removable filter. Cons: Definitely could be more quiet. Twice as loud as central air (my central air is already on the loud side). The fan noise is low pitched though which makes it bearable. Buttons have a cheap feel. Remote is very unresponsive. LEDs on the display are hard to read unless you are looking from ground level.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great supplemental heater
customer_reviews.text: I have hot water heat throughout the house and a wood stove in the basement. If it's not that cold out, I often let the wood stove go out to avoid over heating the whole house. This is fine upstairs as the furnace keeps it warm. As a supplement in the basement, this heater keeps it from getting too cold down there when not burning wood. Probably not a good primary source of heat but for a warming boost now and then works great.
customer_reviews.author: Shane B

customer_reviews.title: Love this heater & ordered a second one!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 3-season porch we ended up using more into the winter than we thought we would. We have a gas fireplace in there and needed a little more heat. This heater does a great job! The temperature can be adjusted to what you desire, then it is automatic, keeping it at that degree. It doesn't get hot to the touch and we set our coffee on the top, using it as a little table. We ordered a second one to take to the office. It's perfect! It may come in black, versus cherry color, so check that out before ordering. I would have rather had black, but the cherry color isn't too red.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work horse heater.
customer_reviews.text: This heater is everything I hoped for. I have a tiny old house. The electric heaters are dangerous and burn stuff if to close and I decided I would no longer use. This heater is a work horse and manages to keep my downstairs very warm. I also found the price to be very reasonable. My electric bill is still within reason for winter time. No spikes in charges.
customer_reviews.author: Michele S. Tracy

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good!! Pro's Keeps your temperature nice and warm It definitely works great Affordable price Cons None Suggestion: Unplug the heater when you leave the house to avoid any unwanted issues. To save energy set it up in automatic so once heater get to the desired temperature it will turn it off or turn it on as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Charles

customer_reviews.title: All these reviews I read about this being super quiet. I got this for bedroom use
customer_reviews.text: I'm really confused. All these reviews I read about this being super quiet. I got this for bedroom use, but when the fans kick in - on auto setting, just so it can check temp - it's like a hair dryer. It's too loud for sleeping. I don't have a decibel meter but I'm sure it's over 39db. Does anyone know of a quiet infrared heater?
customer_reviews.author: UKBananas

customer_reviews.title: Good box heater.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased with the claim it heats faster and more evenly than other brands of this style. Well, it heats good and I like the features and build quality of this heater, but as far as heating goes I think my 49.95 Walmart special heats a small space just as much. However this heater seems not to run as often and does look nicer and seems built better, so I will keep it. Overall I am happy but the claim of putting out more heat that others is overrated in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Btim3

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: We had a gas leak under our house, so the gas was shut off. We bought different varieties of space heaters with different price ranges. This one was well worth the money. It raised the temperature in the room by 12 degrees in less than an hour. For us, it worked best turned on high and we set the other control to room, so it displays the room temperature. It is also safe for pets. We have a dog that loves sitting in front of the heater. With this one, we did not have to be concerned with her burning herself by getting too close. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: K. Riley

customer_reviews.title: A effective, efficient heater
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a similar heater(1500 watts) with this unit after old unit failed. Was unsure if Dr. Infrared heater was going to be able to heat my garage/workshop in dead of winter. Once I understood the thermostat algorithm I was very satisfied with heater.(Read your directions- unlike me). Although the same wattage as my old heater, it does a better job of making my garage comfortable. I have also noticed that as temperatures moderate it uses significantly less electricity than my old heater. Overall a effective little heater.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Small heater that works great!
customer_reviews.text: Great little heater...so I'm ordering another one...very pleased with this product...blows out direct heat so don't sit to close, keeps my front area nice and toasty...
customer_reviews.author: Lamoin47

customer_reviews.title: 4-Year Lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Bought this heater on November 28, 2015. It's now October 12th, 2019 and the heater is dead. While the fan still works the heating element has lost its edge and only pumps out lukewarm air even when set on the highest temps. For $100, I can't really complain; it lasted 4 years. I will be a better unit this time around, as these should last longer given the simplicity. I've had others that last many years more. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: This Little Thing Kicks Butt!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our house heater has been on the fritz for the last two or three years with no electrician of HVAC guy able to find the issue. We only have an 1100 sq. ft home and this little heater gets a majority of the house warmed up nicely. I haven't received my first electric bill yet but I can tell you it's a heck of a lot better than waking up to a home that's only 51 degrees! Buuurrrr no more for now! At least I live in California because I know it could be so much worse.
customer_reviews.author: Silk

customer_reviews.title: Great heater.
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for a full year while building & livig in my cabin. Works like a champ. Keep the unit dust-free for effiency. It has gotten a little noisy but I’m hanging drywall and cutting wood nearby, so I’m sure some dust is in the fan.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S.

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is Awesome! After researching many others and deciding (1) Radiant heat is the way to go, and (2) this is the product I wanted, I was even more pleased than expected. Obviously it's a "heater" and provides "heat". What I don't hear about is that the "heat" is actually, what I refer to as, a "soft" heat. I have several, seriously, several other heaters, but the heat from them can be over-powering and just "harsh". This is totally different! A wise choice!!
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage!!
customer_reviews.text: I would rate this piece of crap heater a ZERO, if I could. It literally worked for ONE month. After calling customer svc, they suggested sending another remote....which, even WITH the warrenty, I had to cover shipping for. I mentioned that it was probably the heater itself, not the remote. But whatever, go ahead and send the remote. After waiting almost a week (btw, we're experiencing freezing temps right now), I get the remote and.......it's STILL not working. Thanks to AMAZON, I was able to return it. Save yourself the $100+ and buy something else!
customer_reviews.author: D.O.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Puts off enough heat to heat at least one full room and even keep the surrounding rooms from getting bitter cold. have used this heater for at least 2 winter seasons now and it heats like it did when it was brand new. It stays on 24/7 and have had no issues with it yet. Have already seen the return on my investment and now just reaping the benefit of having it handy.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: So far really good
customer_reviews.text: Just past the 30 day point with Dr infrared heater 1500 ,have used it every day since it arrived.Weather here has been from 50 to 10 degrees,heater used in a 20x20 new construction room that is not vented to wood heat yet,.it does have very high R factor insulation, and quality windows.This heater has so far done an excellent job of heating the room with little effort.It doesn't seem to dry the air out like previous heater, although it is not the model with the humidifier. I will repost later if any problems develop , but so far this is one of the best small heaters for large space we own.
customer_reviews.author: Lor

customer_reviews.title: Heats very good but thermostat doesn’t work properly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to heat a 350 sq ft. Efficiency condo. This certainly does the job. The thermostat has never worked properly so basically I wake up at night sweating, turn it off until I wake up freezing again. If I had it to do again for the price I would probably try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly78597

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I got this heater mid September worked great but less than a month it stopped working all of the sudden. Doesn't turn on not even the lights, and I missed the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for good price
customer_reviews.text: We live in the cold of Michigan and for the most part accept the cold as part of life, but when family from the south come to visit this product is their best friend! It got rave reviews from all who used it this Holiday season and we didn't have to crank the whole house temperature up. It is quiet and very user friendly with a simple remote. Heats an entire room with no problem and so far seems to be quite economical.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my garage shop. It was rated as the best large room heater. -wrong! There is negligible blower action and couldn't feel the heat. (Barely any even with my hand in front)., I brought it inside to try in my living room with the same results. We let it run for 4 hours without any noticeable temperature difference. Waste of money. Got 2 small cheap oscillating heat fans for less money and noticed the difference quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Power bill will go up, A lot!
customer_reviews.text: If my review was based on heat I would give it a 3 it's puts out good heat! Problem is it's expensive to run this is my third heater of this type the first month I plugged this unit in my power bill went up $100. Bucks! Not a true Infrared heater as read in other reviews
customer_reviews.author: Mark D

customer_reviews.title: Good for about a 12 x 12 room
customer_reviews.text: The unit has been a stalwart in my office for several years. Good for about a 12 x 12 room size
customer_reviews.author: Buhlz_I

customer_reviews.title: Running 24/7 all winter
customer_reviews.text: I got this heater to heat my basement for the winter so my water pipes don't freeze, set it at 60 degrees and left it run all winter non-stop 24/7 and never left me down, there very cold days that my basement was warmer than the rest of my house. Yes! My electric bill tripled but the mess from frozen and broken water pipes would cost a lot more. Very happy with it, didn't expect it to last that long.
customer_reviews.author: BankruptINpa

customer_reviews.title: Not that great.
customer_reviews.text: Could not keep up with Lasko oscillating ceramic heaters I have. Never got to shut off temp. Was afraid to keep running and getting a huge electric bill. I was using 2 Laskos in a 300sqft living room, 35* outside, took a few hours for the laskos to shut off at 70*. Then I ran one Lasko and the Dr Heater, Dr heater couldnt keep up and wouldnt shut off, could not get room to 70*. Oh well, returned it.
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: One of the best heaters I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: I needed a supplemental heat source for a sunroom and the most important aspect was safety. After reading the reviews(which by the way I do take with a grain of salt) I thought that this one sounded like the best bang for my buck. Not sorry I bought this one. It does just what I wanted it to do...help the existing in floor heat keep up when it's cold and windy. In a totally glass room....that's tough. The heater cycles as needed and doesn't overheat the outlet. No hesitation to recommend or buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Missm

customer_reviews.title: Fire starter.
customer_reviews.text: This thing almost caused a fire but it did burn up my on-off switch before the GFCI. I wouldn't buy this thing if you paid me although I bought it once I would never recommend it to anybody anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: David Santo

customer_reviews.title: Love it!  I now have 3!  100%
customer_reviews.text: This heater will melt tour face off!!!!! I have it in a rather large bedroom that is hard to keep warm. This does the job!!!! I love it. I plan to buy another one. I now have 3. 2 for my Rental and one for my house. I plan to get another for my home. These are the most efficient infraread heaters I have bought and I have bought many. I don't have central air and heat and am able to leave them on without worrying if they will catch the house on fire or run up my bill because of the thermostat. The dogs wrestle around them and have knocked into them and everything is fine.
customer_reviews.author: kelly k.

customer_reviews.title: This little heater will surprise you!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heater for my daughter who has a rather large farm house and was having trouble keeping some of the rooms warm without ending up with an astronomical heating bill. When I first day it, I was rather disappointed because it was so small but this little heater surprised me! It keeps her large kitchen or living room very warm and with a 9 month old baby in the house the safety features are a blessing.
customer_reviews.author: Debra McCarty

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: I spent $300 for three of these heaters about two weeks ago. Two of them have already stopped working and the cords have melted. My outlets are going to have to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer mills

customer_reviews.title: Happy customers over 3 years later!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this in our bedroom as our sole heat source during the night for over 3 years and it is just as good as the day we bought it! We like to turn off our entire house heating before we go to bed and just rely on a space heater, and this one has done the job with no issues. We rinse out the filter maybe twice a year and it cleans up well. We use it probably 8 or 9 months of the year as we live in a cold northern climate. Currently our house is not very well insulated and yet this heater still keeps the room comfortably warm! Very highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Hope Martin

customer_reviews.title: A good heater for large spaces
customer_reviews.text: I am using this heater in my wood shop and am very happy with its performance. I have a large(ish) shop so I bought two of these units to keep it warm. I live in SW PA and have single digit temps in the winter. So far, these units have had no problem keeping the shop at 65 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: das

customer_reviews.title: Cold no more!!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: As I sit in my garage keeping warm I had to say it's 2 years later & this wonderful little heater is still doing a great job! If you're on the fence about buying it..jump over & get it! Great price compared to others! I purchased this heater for my one car garage & I'm totally impressed! Love the size. It's on casters & very well built. When it reaches the temperature you set it turns itself off! I would definitely recommend this for any space in your home that gets cold!! Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. C

customer_reviews.title: Fire Hazard - BEWARE!
customer_reviews.text: If your idea of a warranty is to be emailed a link to a site to purchase replacement parts on your dime and a link to a YouTube video to do the work yourself - then this company has an awesome warranty on their defective product. This product nearly caused a fire in my house after the heating element shorted out. You get what you pay for when the product in marked “Made in China.”
customer_reviews.author: Kyle McDowell

customer_reviews.title: too powerful for old wiring
customer_reviews.text: This heater cranks, and it was really helpful for quite awhile, but it must draw more power than my electrical could handle, because it melted its plug and my wall socket! Don't use in an older house. It didn't warn me there was a problem either, I just smelled it start to melt down. If you have a newer house w better electrical it would probably be awesome. Nice compact design.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Hull

customer_reviews.title: Does not heat efficiently or a lot
customer_reviews.text: I read so much about the most efficient heaters. This is in no shape, form or fashion, an efficient or effective way to heat a house or room. I bought 4, one for each room in my house. Each room is 150 to 400 sq ft. They stay on so much and the cost of ele at the end of the day is the same as it was before. I don't find this better than central air/heat, gas or any other method. ...other than a wood stove. I do not recommend this for any serious heating and/or to save money.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: I received this heater damaged. It had a big gash/hole in the front right by the control panel. Got a replacement and the second one was also damaged, it had broken wheel and scratches all over. Both heaters arrived in a regular box, not the original product box. Horrible and super small.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: It's okaym does the job
customer_reviews.text: I had an old one that I ran to death so I purchased a new one. This one doesn't work quite as well, but it is fine. It does the job. Times and models do change. It's not as good as my old Dr. It does work pretty quickly. Thermostat is not as responsive as the old one. Does what it is supposed to do well enough. I don't love it as much, but the colder it gets, I might.
customer_reviews.author: Janel Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Loved this heater so much, we bought another!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second purchase. The one in our great room worked so well (we've had it for a long time...want to say a year but don't recall the exact duration) that we bought one for our master. It works just as well there. Good heat output and easy to clean filter. Power consumption is on par with comparable heaters of its size. Would (and have) recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: Overall a nice heater
customer_reviews.text: This heater has worked very well for heating any room I've needed it to. My biggest complaints are that the IR sensor will react to literally any command from any remote. If I try to turn off my TV it will turn on the heater. My other complaint is that the fan is much louder than I wish it were. The description called it "super quiet" which it is definitely not. I have to turn my TV up quite a bit to hear it over the fan, and the fan comes on every 5 minutes or so in auto mode regardless of whether the heater comes on so it can get a bit annoying after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin V.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my RV
customer_reviews.text: I rv full time and have a 40’ fifth wheel. Was in Reno for the winter and was going through a tank of propane a week running the furnace. Bought this heater and was so happy with it. On warmer winter days we ran it with the fireplace, on really cold windy days we put the furnace on auto and ran the heater on medium. The furnace hardly kicked on. The heat output was great and it maintained the temperature. It replaced my Vornado. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Stitch

customer_reviews.title: So grateful for the warmth!
customer_reviews.text: Our temp dropped 20 degrees in the last few days and I'm so grateful for the arrival of this heater. I'm not prepared for the cost of heating oil just yet (will I ever be?). I'm not knowledgeable enough to give a sound product review just yet. I can only say that on this chilly rainy morning the heat this baby is putting out is worth 5 stars to me!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Webb

customer_reviews.title: great longevity of functionality; very solid construction
customer_reviews.text: I have exceptionally low expectations for the durability of electronic products, and this one still works flawlessly after nearly four years (and well into its fourth winter), so I suppose I can't forbear to give it a "glowing" ☺ review. Besides, it's extremely attractive, impervious to minor knocks (sue me: I'm clumsy), and positively exudes solidity of construction. (I'd have been tempted to say "radiates," but I generally try to avoid perpetrating variants of the same lame double entendre twice in a single paragraph. ☺)
customer_reviews.author: video meliora proboque

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: At first I was sceptical about this heater. I read some of the reviews, most definitely don't know what their talking about. This is the best forced air heater for it's size that I have ever owned. Very efficient temperature accuracy is where it should be. Set @ 72° indoor thermometer reading 73.8°. I'm happy
customer_reviews.author: Douglas G.

customer_reviews.title: It makes a difference
customer_reviews.text: It's true that 1500 watts is 1500 watts, what ever electric heater you use. Scientifically, it doesn't put out any more heat than a cheapo. But this thing--wow, I get almost-instant directed heat into the cold little niche where I work from home, and as a result, I probably use less electricity. Very happy. Would be even happier if it could make chicken fried steak.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Drumm

customer_reviews.title: Love ! Very cost efficient!
customer_reviews.text: I love these heaters ! Safe for kids & pets ! Does not get hot on the surface.. but don’t keep it to close to the wall or curtain .. it needs clearance to preform ! Plus the heat from the front of if too close my cause fire.. I love the built it safety feature .. zig it is tipped over it automatically turns itself off.. so if this does happen do not think it’s broken .. it does that a few minutes when you go to turn back on! Very cost efficient & keeps you warm & own 2 !
customer_reviews.author: SUZIE Q

customer_reviews.title: Can blow house fuses
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, it's probably my old house and the strange wiring they did here, but this blew a fuse within the first few minutes. It's probably just my house, but if you have an older home, be aware that you might have to return this.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Kibler

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I had two large and expensive edenpure heaters both went bad this last winter I bought two of these to replace them. This heater is much smaller but puts out the same or better heat with more control options and significantly cheaper price. I bought one to try out I was skeptical with the price but I liked it so much I ordered another shortly after.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Dr. IR Heater review.
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled with the size. Works better than my bigger Kenmore IR heater. Heat kicks in right away. My Kenmore IR heater has a lag time - seems like there is a pre heating period before the heat kicks in and has a buzzer like sound when you turn the heater on. Dr. IR heater is quieter and heats up the area much quicker than my Kenmore IR heater. The casing does not heat after hours of operation. Now I know which IR heater to buy if I need another one.
customer_reviews.author: F35

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Small Unit
customer_reviews.text: Heater remains cool to the touch while adjusting to the temperature set by the user. Stylish to suit any decor. It heats the great room within five minutes after starting. The spring can be quite breezy thus the house temperature lowers and turning on the furnace for one room isn't in the budget. The wheels enable you to move it from room to room.
customer_reviews.author: Rel

customer_reviews.title: Cut my heating costs significantly!
customer_reviews.text: I have a two story condo with one AC/Heating unit. The downstairs was cold all the time during the winter and my heating costs were high. I put one of these downstairs and my bills are way down and my house is so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DR infrared portable heater
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good heater, it does the job well, but it is on the higher end of the price scale for this size and type of heater. Other than the higher price, there is nothing stopping me from recommending this portable heater for someone looking to supplement the heat in a room..
customer_reviews.author: Michael Babb

customer_reviews.title: Company does us right!
customer_reviews.text: We love ours Keeps room very comfortable, and we keep our house furnace on 65 at night. We bought one about 2 1/2 years ago and it worked great till about a month ago it caught fire inside, so I turned it off immediately and called Company. I sent it back and the Company sent us a new one. it took about a month, so in the meantime we bought another one, so we have one upstairs and one downstairs when we need them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for off-grid Solar applications
customer_reviews.text: This thing here! I have experience with all heater types , but this little central air unit is the best. This thing forces heat into the room unlike other space heaters that just glow cherry red without heating a thing. Im impressed and I may be ordering another extra one. I think if you put one of these on each floor, there will be no need for actual gas/oil heat. It looks nice and was packaged well. It was delivered fast. t has a classic look. And Fyi, this thing is hooked to a 300watt solar systems and it runs mighty fine. Thanks Obama.
customer_reviews.author: Hajilo

customer_reviews.title: Watt meter confirmed 1500watt usage.  Maintains heat well.
customer_reviews.text: We used a watt meter on the heater the first day and it does in fact use 1500 watts when we set the thermostat to 78F. I have a small studio apartment about 300sq ft and I set the heater to 66F when I'm out and 67 to 70F when I'm home and it clicks on for about 30-60 seconds every 5 or so minutes to maintain the temperature. It's fairly quiet. Rolls around easily. No problems so far, works great. Will check watt usage again after a month or so and update.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: Temperature control (unit thermostat) does not seem to work. I have to keep turning it on and off with remote to control proper temperature output. Not sure eco mode really does anything. Doesn't come close to heating 1000 square foot space and I live in Southern California. Can't imagine this would be useful in a cold climate.
customer_reviews.author: Real Doc

customer_reviews.title: A+ works good!
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I waited to review it until I had a good chance to try it out. And it is a winner in the winter it keeps the main space comfortable no hot or cold spots in the livingroom. Comfortable heat easy to use and I think it's one of the safest electric heaters I have used. Cord and plug stay cool to the touch. Auto mode works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: K. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Great!
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this is great EXCEPT for the fact that the remote does not turn on the heater. You have to manually turn the unit on and the remote is just for changing the settings. I honestly never use the remote because I just change the settings when I'm up to turn the heater on.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt keep tiny room warm after 120 intermittent usage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jan. 23 2019 for the winter to keep my enclosed 6' x 8' porch warm for about 3 hours a day 4 times a week. Only used it until March. It one year later and I have been using it for 3 weeks and have to keep it on highest setting to keep the room at barely 50 degrees. Its not as cold as last year. Last year it kept it cozy. Done routine maintenance on this as I'm anal about stuff like that. Bad review for not lasting. Maybe used it a total of 120 hours. Very disappointed with longevity
customer_reviews.author: Tresa J. Minthorn

customer_reviews.title: Not good with high ceilings
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the claim was that since it is infrared, the heat does not travel up. Well we have high ceilings and it performs the same way a cheap heater performs. You have to be right up on it to get any benefit. If you have high ceilings, don’t waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: shanna

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It's absolutely wonderful, even if it's not very attractive. One star loss for look and how much it costs to operate. After getting my electric bill, I feel like I might as well turn on my heat. I got it to only heat up my office instead of centrally heating the whole house all day, but it didn't save much money It heats up an entire large room easily. And that I love.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: It works... Exceeds expectations. Good material.
customer_reviews.text: Love love love it! My newly remodeled 1895 home doesn't have a heating system yet. Initially I bought one unit and it kept my room nice and cozy. I keep it at 69-72 degrees and it only turns on a few times a day to achieve this. I tried MANY other infrared and small space heaters... This one is the best. So I bought a second unit... Two of these suckers keep my upstairs (three medium size bedrooms, a bathroom and hallway) nice and warm if I leave my bedroom doors open. Very economical and good looking. Definitely good quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Picky ShopAholic

product_meta.title: Dr Infrared Heater Portable Space Heater, 1500-Watt
product_meta.description: Color:CherryThe Dr. Infrared Heater's Advanced Dual Heating System, combining PTC and Quartz Infrared Element, keeps you warm this winter while saving on heating bills. Equipped with a Dual Heating System and High Velocity Low Noise blower, the Dr. Infrared Heater increases the heat distribution and the result is heating your room to a comfortable temperature, fast. The Dr. Infrared Heater is certified by Underwriters Laboratories (UL) USA and Canada, ensuring the highest safety standard. The Dr. Infrared Heater is perfectly safe around children and pets and only gets warm to the touch. It does not have exposed heating elements that can cause a fire. The Dr. Infrared Heater comes with Energy saving Auto Mode, high and low setting when the mode is set to Auto, the unit will cycle on and off and switch between high or low setting to maintain the desired temperature setting. All Dr. Infrared heaters are engineered and designed in the USA. How is Dr. Heater Different from Other Heaters? Dr. Heater uses infrared heating, which heats objects in the room, instantly making you feel comfortably warm. By heating only the objects in the space--not the air--Dr. Heater provides maximum warmth and energy efficiency. With its state-of-the-art technology that helps the room retain air moisture, Dr. Heater do not dry out your skin like those convection heaters that blast out hot air, stripping the room of moisture. And the best part? It will save you money. Use Dr. Heater instead of your regular heating system, and you could save up to 50% on your next electricity bill. Plus, with its tip-over protection and auto shut-off overheat protection, you can sleep soundly knowing you have got a heater that is superior in safety. Tests Show Dr. Heater heats Faster and Better than Competing Heaters. In a side-by-side test comparison in airtight chambers with the same starting temperature, Dr. Heater heated the same amount of space much faster than a competing heater that has a price tag more than double that of Dr. Heater. Dr. Heater Delivers 60% more heat than other 1500-watt heaters. No magic trick--we just understand heat transfer better. Just because two heaters have the same wattage does not mean they transfer the same amount of heat. Wattage indicates the amount of electricity needed to power the heater--not the amount of heat it can deliver. Heater is the first to feature a dual heating system for maximum heat transfer rate. It combines the energy efficiency of infrared heat with the comfort of convection heat to heat your room fast and comfortably--without hot spots and cold spots. Dr. Heater uses a state-of-the-art 7-inch blower that generates higher pressure and moves larger air volume at a lower speed, without any of the noise of those other heaters on the market. Dr. Infrared Heater has three power Settings: Auto, Low 1000W and High 1500W. The auto energy saving mode allows you to set your desired temperature from 50-86F. It smartly selects between the two settings depending on your room temperature. The thermostat regulates the heater and causes it to cycle on and off to maintain the set temperature. You can also manually set the heater to run on High or Low all the time or with a timer. The heater has to be turned on first in order to use the remote. This a safety provision mandated by the Underwriters Laboratory. So, in order to use the remote, the first step for the user is to press the POWER button on the heater itself. This turns the heater on STANDBY. Then, pressing the POWER button on the remote will turn the heater on. The heater can't be turned on if the unit is not on STANDBY.
feature_bullets: Can heat up a large room with Auto Energy Saving Model With High and Low Feature. Tip-over protection and Overheat protection
Dual Heating Systems featuring infrared quartz tube + PTC with 12hr automatic shut-off timer
IR Remote Control, High Pressure Low Noise Blower with Noise level 39 dB super quiet. Heating can cover for a large room.
Electronic Thermostat: range 50 to 86 degrees. Caster Wheels and lifetme filter
Weights 24 lbs and uses 12.5 Amps of Power. 1500 Watts.Electric Cord 72 inch long

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,790 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
